questions.question: What is the primary reason for determining the heat of hydration of cement?

answers.a: To measure the setting time of cement
answers.b: To prevent thermal cracking in concrete
answers.c: To determine the fineness of cement
answers.d: To improve the workability of cement

explanations.b: Heat of hydration generates heat, which can cause thermal cracking in large concrete structures if not managed properly.

questions.question: Which chemical reaction occurs when water is added to cement?

explanations.b: Hydration is the chemical reaction where cement reacts with water to form a paste that binds aggregates together.

questions.question: What type of reaction is the hydration of cement?

explanations.b: Hydration of cement is an exothermic reaction, meaning it releases heat as the cement sets and hardens.

questions.question: Why is gypsum added to cement?

answers.c: To control the rapid heat and reaction of C₃A

explanations.c: Gypsum is added to control the rapid hydration of C₃A (tricalcium aluminate), preventing flash setting of cement.

questions.question: Which apparatus is used to determine the heat of hydration of cement?

explanations.d: A calorimeter is used to measure the heat of hydration of cement by quantifying the heat released during hydration.
